references.paper_title: B-cos Networks: Alignment is All We Need for Interpretability
references.reason: This paper introduces the B-cos networks, which are the foundation of the B-cosification method presented in the main paper.

references.paper_title: B-cos Alignment for Inherently Interpretable CNNs and Vision Transformers
references.reason: This paper extends the B-cos framework to vision transformers and provides further insights into the interpretability benefits of B-cos networks, which are crucial for understanding the proposed B-cosification method.

references.paper_title: ImageNet: A Large-Scale Hierarchical Image Database
references.reason: ImageNet is the foundational dataset used in the experiments for both supervised classification and CLIP-based zero-shot classification, making it a critical reference for the experimental results.

references.paper_title: Learning Transferable Visual Models From Natural Language Supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the CLIP model, a large vision-language model which is the focus of the B-cosification experiments in Section 4.2.

references.paper_title: Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
references.reason: ResNet architectures are used in the supervised classification experiments, and thus this foundational paper on ResNet is highly relevant to the study.
